answers.answer: Sometimes viruses can hang on for a long time.   When she eats, what does she eat.  When you have been having a stomach virus it is recommended that you reintroduce regular foods slowly and follow the BRAT diet for a few days.  (bananas, rice, applesauce, toast) .    It is easy when a child is feeling better and hungry to let them eat like before they were sick, but the intestinal tract can be irritated and rebel when food is reintroduced too quickly.

question: my 9 yr old type 1 diabetic has had on and off stomach pain (around umbilicus) and nausea with vomiting for 10 days now.  Her glucose levels are good, no complications from the diabetes - her abdominal catscan was normal except for haziness around appendix, she shows no clinical signs of appendicitis - no LRQ pain, no rebound pain,can jump w/o pain, can bend knee w/o pain, her WBC is normal, stool sample is normal, celiac bloodwork is negative,  MD thinks it is viral but i worry it is something functional.  Could a virus cause this pattern of illness, for instance today she was fine after breakfast, had lunch at 1:30 and felt fine until 4:30pm when the pain and nausea came back and remained through now ( it is 7:30pm).  goinf on the 11th day - seems too long to be viral.  what do u think, any tests i should ask for?thanks
title: 10 days of stomach pain
